snippet: Grid cells, which provide a sort of dead reckoning navigation, had until now only been recorded in some animals.
abstract: Researchers report in journal Nature Neuroscience that they have located navigationsl grid cells, similar to those used by rodents, bats and nonhuman primates for a form of dead reckoning navigation, in human brain.
lead_paragraph: Grid cells, which provide a sort of dead reckoning navigation, had until now only been recorded in some animals.

headline.main: Navigational Cells Located in Human Brains
headline.print_headline: Navigational Cells Located in Human Brains
